We have issued a severe #flood warning for #EastDidsbury #WestDidsbury and #Northenden which means a threat to life and significant disruption. 
We are working with the emergency services to keep communities to keep people safe. Updates ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV https://t.co/Ue0KEP0snL

‚ö†Ô∏è @gmpolice & @EnvAgencyNW have announced a Severe Flood Warning covering parts of Didsbury, Chorlton & Northenden as levels of the River Mersey rise. ‚ö†Ô∏è

The @EnvAgencyYNE are nearing the trigger to use #RotherRegulators which protect property through @RMBCPress & @MyDoncaster.

tweets.text: Some intense rainfall over West Mids this evening on our radars (pink on the picture).  Worst of the rain will clear about midnight, don't be surprised if you see a bit of snow either..but do stay up to date with Flood Warnings from @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/nz681AdVjq https://t.co/pOr3wLooRG

More heavy rain coming in next 24 hours. Remember: even when the weather calms, rivers continue to rise, so please check #FloodWarnings all week here: https://t.co/CnoJPZIDpY It's a free service, updated every 15 mins. It could save your life. #PrepareActSurvive @EnvAgency https://t.co/swa11ANaVu

tweets.text: UPDATE: 7.30pm: Wet & windy day @EnvAgencyYNE @Calderdale defences tested, river & canal been high. Amber warning remains in place, but stabilising & levels reducing. Warning ICE from 0100 as rains ease. Outstanding effort #teamcalderdale inc @slowtheflow_UK #StormChristoph üôè
A round-up of pictures as floods and snow hit #Warrington https://t.co/hh5o0fj6yT https://t.co/vsPK67k42I

urls.title: Warrington floods in pictures as snow arrives in town!
urls.description: PICTURES: AFTER a day of flooding problems across the town, Warrington was hit with a surprise snow flurry on Wednesday evening, to add to the problems.

tweets.text: Since the serious floods a few years ago heavy rain always makes me nervous. There is a lot of new infrastructure in place however - thank you @tmbc_highways and @EnvAgencyNW for all your work https://t.co/GQhOC3336Y

tweets.text: Our thoughts are with @EnvAgency staff and other Cat 1 & 2 responders, voluntary organisations and community #volunteers responding to the impact of #StormChristoph and the communities that lie in its path. A very difficult start to 2021 but we look towards brighter times.
We continue to work with partners to reduce #floodrisk as part of this multi-agency response. https://t.co/gXridj0XNu

tweets.text: @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd
@AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE Spot on, we put the steel defences up around Kirk Sandal substation in 2019, didn't take long. We put security on it as well, didn't want it being pinched.
@helenpidd @EnvAgencyNW We in Northenden in the red zone, we less then a min walk away from the river just waiting game now to see if we are evacuated, police been outside our house for good 4 hours

Due to the flooding & it‚Äôs widespread & impactful nature a Major Incident for Derbyshire has been declared. Multi Agency operation in operation - not made easier because of C19. My thanks to all dedicated staff & workers across all services involved. Stay safe & heed warnings. https://t.co/lNJ02gNhFG

Flow monitoring has just been installed on two of the rain planters @CarshaltonHigh. This will improve understanding of how the planters are storing and slowing down the flow of water to reduce flood risk, and allow us to improve our future designs. #SuDSnotFloods @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/eE0EVxI3Cn

Once again Parkgate Road is closed due to flooding from Finchett's Gutter & the Highfield Drain. A few houses at risk plus @AldiUK (we did warn them). The flood lagoon by the @CountessPark is full & the #CountessCountryPark is well under in places, please avoid.
@GPorterStandard https://t.co/QdzpgwouGv
